entry.title: Stitches and Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,930Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 396

Summary: Helena and Ramon Diaz rush to Los Angeles after hearing their son Eddie has been shot, only to discover that he’s already home recovering, with Christopher and an unexpected presence—Evan “Buck” Buckley—firmly at his side. As Helena grapples with the realization of how much of Eddie’s life she’s missed, old wounds and long-buried regrets surface.Navigating the awkward terrain of reconciliation, Helena finds herself watching Buck’s easy presence in Eddie and Christopher’s lives. He’s not just a friend—he’s family. But as Eddie and Helena confront their strained relationship, new truths about Buck and Eddie’s bond come into focus.In a home filled with love, laughter, and a surprising number of PB&Js, Helena must decide whether she’s ready to let go of the past and embrace the future Eddie has built. Because sometimes, family isn’t about where you come from—it’s about who shows up when it matters most.

entry.title: Badly Beaten Self Esteem Has Got Me Needing You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiesbro

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,712Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 96

Summary: Who did he think he was anyway, strolling into the 118 with his hair and his body and his eyes, with a smirk that bled confidence. Who did he think he was to appear and insert himself into their family like he belonged when Buck himself had grafted, scraped and clawed his way to belonging.He could feel Bobby’s eyes on him, he could feel Hen wanting to reach out, could feel Chimney’s confusion but they didn’t understand. This, the firehouse, this team, this family was his. It was all Buck had. They didn’t understand how threatened he felt, his hackles raised and chest tense everytime Bobby clapped Eddie on the shoulder. They didn’t know about the nausea that clawed at him every time Chimney poked fun at Buck, with Eddie. They couldn’t fathom the way his head spun every time Hen complimented Eddie on his skills as a medic, sounding genuinely impressed.OrBuck has some serious undiagnosed mental health issues, pushes them aside and becomes everyone's sounding board, soaks up their problems and ignores his own, until he can't anymore.OrBuck slowly realises that maybe he's not a burden, that he doesn't need to make his problems smaller to make room for others.

entry.title: The History of Cinnamon Sorrow
entry.summary:
Author: ElvenSorceress

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,259Chapters: 6/10Kudos: 71

Summary: “Now that you’re here, we should discuss Christopher staying with us for the foreseeable future. It would be so much better for him. He should be able to have a mother’s care. I’m really the only mother he’s ever known.”Eddie rankles at the words. But knew she’d say it. He’s so fucking tired.He can’t even imagine what his mother would say if she knew Eddie was in love with a man and that Chris will probably never have any mother except Shannon. “I was guessing Chris will want to stay where he is. For now. I don’t want to uproot him. Not when he’s happy and doing well.”She actually smiles this time. For real. “That’s a very caring, wise decision. I’m proud of you.”God. Fucking god. It hurts but it also feels like a rush of hope and Eddie could scream. Or cry. Or both. And doesn’t know which he should do, but he’s definitely dangling over a 5000 foot cliff somewhere. Why does something he inexplicably wants so badly make him feel like such shit?~Eddie arrives in El Paso to mend his family and confront his childhood sorrows.

entry.title: to love someone who lets you break them twice
entry.summary:
Author: tinygiantsam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,944Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 464

Summary: “You signed off on your rights to get jealous five years ago.”Eddie stared, his eyes shifting in real time. He brought a hand up to touch his own lips and chin, tugging at the corners like he couldn’t stay still. “You wanna repeat that?”Buck held the stare, biting his lips in thought. He couldn’t help but to glance down at Eddie’s. “Yeah,” he said after a while, his voice deeper. “You lost me, Eddie. And it was a choice you made.”Something similar to a chuckle came out of Eddie’s throat, but they hadn’t been apart long enough for Buck to think he had found something funny. No, Eddie was angry. “There isn’t an inch of you that doesn’t belong to me.”OR: divorced buddie meets again after five years - or so. (includes rage sex, and an eddie with hidden intentions).

entry.title: L is for the way you Lose Me
entry.summary:
Author: FantasyandFlowers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,348Chapters: 11/11Kudos: 66

Summary: “Buck, have you seen Eddie?” Bobby sounds panicked.“What- no? Have you?”“No, where are you now?”“I’m at his house; it looks like someone destroyed it,” Buck’s voice falters, shaking with each word. Why is Bobby so terrified?“He’s not at home?” Bobby asks with a serious tone.“No, what’s going on?” Buck asks. Suddenly, the world is spinning; this is all wrong. Eddie should be here. Where is he?“They just found Eddie’s car abandoned on the side of the road.”“No.” Buck starts shaking his head. This can’t be happening. No. Eddie was headed home to talk to Christopher last night. He wasn’t supposed to go anywhere else.“Stay there, kid. I’m already on my way to you,” Bobby says.“Where’s Eddie?” Buck asks. He knows it’s childish, a pointless question that Bobby can’t answer.“We’ll find him,” Bobby reassures.orEddie is getting ready to move to Texas, but why can't he shake this feeling he has towards leaving Buck behind? Buck wants to tell Eddie how he feels, but he would never ask Eddie to choose between him and Christopher. But they both lose their chance to confess anything when Eddie is mysteriously kidnapped with no leads.

entry.title: Through the Smoke
entry.summary:
Author: Ares9903

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 511Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: When Evan “Buck” Buckley’s steady life with pilot Tommy Kinard collides with the arrival of Eddie Diaz—a guarded ex-Army medic turned firefighter—sparks fly in ways neither expected. Between blazing infernos and crumbling ruins, Buck’s loyalty frays as Eddie’s quiet strength cracks his world open, igniting a forbidden pull neither can douse. From stolen kisses to a cowboy-clad Halloween night, their bond deepens through the chaos—earthquakes shattering bones, past ghosts clawing back, and a love that defies the flames. With the 118 as their anchor and Chris as their heart, Buck and Eddie fight for a future forged in ash—culminating in a wedding that seals their scars into something unbreakable. It is a slow-burn tale of courage, desire, and family rising from the smoke.

  • Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
